title: Roosters star Cooper Cronk loses his $10,000 premiership ring just moments after the NRL Grand Final
text:
A desperate search was launched in the Sydney Roosters dressing room on Sunday night after footy star Cooper Cronk lost his premiership ring.

The retiring halfback had been celebrating the NRL Grand Final win with his teammates when he lost the ring - his sixth - in all the excitement.

Each ring is encrusted with 160 diamonds, and is worth $10,000.

'I think [I lost it] in all the jumping around and cheering,' he told reporters.

'I've got bad fingers and it must have slid off.'

Retiring Sydney Roosters halfback Cooper Cronk lost his premiership ring on Sunday night amid the grand final celebrations

The ring (pictured) is worth $10,000 and encrusted with 160 diamonds. Cooper won his sixth premiership ring on Sunday night

Luckily for Cronk, as he was fielding questions about the Roosters' win, a search party was working behind the scenes to retrieve the valuable piece of jewellery.

A Roosters insider was seen walking up to Cronk as he continued his media duties, with the ring in hand.

'I found it for you,' she said, handing over the ring to Cronk, who called her a 'godsend' in response.

The ring had been in an esky.

The 35-year-old said he didn't keep his impressive collection of rings on display and this one would be added to the others.

He won rings in 2007, 2009, 2012 and 2017 with Melbourne and then 2018 and this one with the Roosters.

'It will collect dust somewhere,' he said.

'I'm not nostalgic, it just sits somewhere in a box and they won't see the light of day.'

Cronk said he always believed the diamond-encrusted ring, which was designed this year by former North Queensland great Johnathan Thurston, would turn up.

They have their player number engraved into them.

'There's only one of them so I people would know who it would belong to,' he said.
description: A desperate search was launched in the Sydney Roosters dressing room on Sunday night after retiring halfback Cooper Cronk lost his premiership ring.
authors: Hannah Moore For Daily Mail Australia
